text: Central Gujarat, also known as Charuttar or Charotar, is a region in the Indian state of Gujarat. This region consists of a total of six districts, including Bharuch, Gandhinagar, Anand, Kheda, Ahmedabad, and Vadodara. ==Languages== The most spoken language in the region is Charotari, which is a dialect of the Gujarati language. ==Occupation== Farming is a primary occupation among the locals. ==Educational institutes== The Anand Agricultural University is an important government educational institute in Central Gujarat, located in Anand district. ==References== Category:Regions of Gujarat
title: Central Gujarat
